review_blob: I was told this is the new version of the Centennial Amber since it was the award winner.  Outstanding aroma and mouthfeel-a good cross between an amber and red, with enough hops to keep it from being sweet.  One of the best Ive ever had at Emmetts-and thats saying a lot.

Batch 8278-seems very fresh.  I had a Two Hearted with dinner and another nice IPA afterwards, then had this a couple hours later.  Oh My God!  I can only think of a couple beers that left me speechless after a first taste.  This is just amazing stuff.  I have officially found a new addiction.  I might give a more concise deScription later, but for now Im just awestruck.

Poured pretty flat, with a small late forming head.  Smells like a oatmeal stout with a nice amount of roast and coffee aroma.  A good solid Imperial Stout, but starts to come apart as it warms.  Hops and bitterness from roast starts to overwhelm a bit.  Nice beer for the style.
Im not a fan of so called "flavored" beers, but this one does pretty well.  Not too much vanilla and a pretty well rounded porter.
My 3rd favorite beer at Lazlos.  Nice and malty and enough complexity to be enjoyable as your 1st or 4th beer of the night.
Pretty nice.  Not in my top 5 IPAs, but Id buy it again.  Has a different hop profile than somthing like 2 Hearted or other citrus bombs, but I like it.
Damn nice beer.  Straddles the line between IPA and Barleywine and does it well.  I will definitely buy more of this
A little lighter than Nego Modelo, but I had to pick up a bottle since Id never heard of it before.  Nothing remarkable, but a decent mex beer.

Jason and Jim are great guys and Im glad to taste something that really makes me want to buy a case-a keg-some large amount.  Their beer has always been very well made, but I feel as though their palates and mine look for different things.  This is a nice hoppy beer with a lot going on.  Im a big fan of rye beers and this does not dissapoint.  I dont like to dissect beers, but this has the aroma, good hop presence and plenty of malt to keep it together.  Me love the cane!

Yes, it is expensive.  But then again, so is caviar and Dom.  No, its not in that realm, but it is good and the bottle is just gorgeous.  Ive been a Rogue fan for over 15 years now and have always loved the range of things they bring to the table.  Kind of along the lines of Stones most recent anniversary beer or 
Alesmiths Yulesmith.  Hoppy and big-chewy, really a nice beer.  I would probably not buy another bottle at this price, but I applaud Rogue for bringing out a big, bad well packaged beer for the big 10000!

As is the distinction with Arrogant Bastard, I wouldnt really call this an IPA. Its got way too much malt character and in my opinion, a slightly muted hop character-especially in the nose.  I mail ordered 6 bombers, and Im excited.  Very nice beer-sort of like Double Bastard, but a bit more hoppy.  Rockin stuff....
Pretty nice wheat.  Would like a bit more yeast in the bottle for the truly yeasty experience, but nice on a hot day.

Ive never had a Chouffe beer that I didnt like, but this is my favorite.  It is a tad overcarbonated, but with careful pouring, it wasnt a huge problem.  Doesnt have a ton of American hop character, but quite a bit of bitterness. I finished a bottle all by my self and will buy more.

Ive actually made a homebrew version of an Imperial Pilsner and it tasted very similar to this. Not a beer Id ever buy again, especially for this ridiculous price, but fun to try I guess.  Hops are relatively subdued for supposedly being continually hopped.  Lots of pils malt flavor and ample bitterness.
Pretty tasty even though Im not a sour beer fan.  Great looking beer with a fluffy white head and nice dark golden color.  Some nice spiciness comes through as it warms.

One big bad mofo of a beer.  I really like it though.  Very much along the lines of Dogfishs WWS, but different in some way that I can discern.  Im glad I bought a couple because I have a feeling this will age nicely. I like that its well carbonated-not too much though.

Im glad to be able to find this in single bottles, as I wont pay the $18.99 for a four pack theyre asking.  Pretty nice beer, but my example is less hoppy aromawise than I would suspect.  It was bottled 4 monthes ago, so I would suspect that it might have been better earlier.  Reminds me of Dogfishs 90 Min IPA back when it was bottled in big bottles.  Very hoppy and very bitter.  Still, a good beer.
At Yiayias in Lincoln-nice color and head.  A tad bit sweet for my taste, but a nice coffee flavor. I enjoyed the pint I had, but dont think I could finish another one.

Youd figure if SN went out of their way to bottle an IPA it would be significantly hoppier than their usual Pale and close to as good as Celebration-yet this is not either of those.  Pretty middle of the road and not very inspired.  Would like more bitterness and more hop aroma to get my hop jones going.

I just have a hard time with all these double IPAs that dont have a wonderful fresh hop aroma.  It seems like the higher they go in alcohol, the less they have that nice dry hop aroma.  This IS a nice beer though.  Well made and enjoyable, but the jump from IPA to Double means that what you gain in body and booze, you lose in hoppiness and really, IPAness.  I have the same complaint of 90 IPA, and several others too.  Still, Id buy this again.

Just didnt do it for me-smells a bit like a hoppy pilsner, but not enough to entice me.  I had this a few years ago and liked it better, but this sixer just doesnt get my hop jones going.  Not bad, but not at all dreamy.

I hate to bring down the average of this beer, but I must have aged it too long or something.  I bought this in Portland at Johns and brought it right back to Illinois to a home in my beer fridge-stored at a loving 45 degrees for probably 8 months and I looked forward to trying this beer with great anticipation.  The aroma is nice-bready, and spicy, but no hops.  The palate seems a bit understated for a 10% ABV beer and just doesnt jump out at me.  Will definitely rerate with a fresh bottle the next time Im in PDX.
2004 bottle-aged in my cellar for a year.  Nice beer, better than I remembered last year.  Lots of malty, toasty goodness and a clean finish.  One of the better X-mas seasonals

Very few American made belgian styles have enough carbonation to be to style, but this one actually does.  I prefer Hennepin, but this is a nice example of a Saison.  It needs something to make it a little more interesting-spices, more hops, etc, but a nice beer overall.
Nice integration of malt and hop flavors.  Enjoyed on our lanai in Kauai, so its hard to not like this beer and really, its pretty good.  From a bomber bottle.
I mustve gotten a bad bottle-I thought this was ridiculously sweet and almost undrinkable.  Just didnt do it for me at all.  One of the first Avery beers that I didnt like.
Love this beer-stout and chocolate.  Im not sure I need the added chocolate, but still, its a lot of fun to drink.

Beautiful beer-nice fluffy head and great color.  Reminds me a bit of New World Porter from Avery-I like hops in a dark beer.  Doesnt totally seal the deal, but a great beer nonetheless.  Would like more body to go with all the lovely hoppiness.

My last rating got eaten by the system, but in short-needs more hops to be a double, or triple IPA-not more bittering, but more flavor, more aroma.  Very alcoholic-not in a bad way, but just doesnt hit the mark exactly.  Nice stuff though.
Not a double IPA, but a nice beer anyway.  Just had a sample, but nice level of hoppiness and malt.  Id drink this regularly if I lived nearby.

What a beautiful beer!  I wouldnt love it so much, but I got to share a bottle with some of the guys at the brewery and it was FREE!!!  Now Im at home and objectively tasting it.  And its sooo good.  The oak melds so well with everything else.  What a nice beer....I cant give a good deScription, but if you dont like this-youre, well, youre just plain crazy.  Thats all I can say.  Oak aged Imperial Stouts...the next big thing I think.  Oh wait, they already are!!
beer_name: Great Divide Yeti Imperial Stout - Oak Aged

review_blob: Just kind of blah.  Not real malty, not real hoppy-not sure what style Id call this.  It really just reminds me of a mediocre brewpubs version of an Amber Ale.  Ill stick with Two Hearted and Kalamzoo stout.

Dark. Black. Strong. Yummy.  Hides it alcohol well and I want more of this stuff.  Id say this is my favorite DFH beer and one of my top 3 Impy Stouts.  Good for sharing or drinking the whole bottle yourself.
Not the best from Bells, but I actually like this beer.  Tasty and interesting.  It took me a couple bottles to get this beer, but I actually like it.

Im not going to give a lengthy deScription of this beer, because I think others have gone into great detail, but obviously, its a great beer.  Is it in my top 5 all time-no, is it my favorite Impy Stout-no, thatd be Speedway from Alesmith, but theres no denying that its very well made and visually, one of the most beautiful beers Ive ever had.  I wish I had a second bottle, because I think it could benefit from at least a year of aging.
beer_name: Three Floyds Dark Lord Russian Imperial Stout

review_blob: Reminds me a bit of Little Kings-light, a slight creamed corn sweetness.  Not a bad lawmower beer, but not something Id ever buy again.

One of the best Goldens out there.  More character than a Duvel and enough carbonation to fool you into thinking its really a belgian made beer.  Im not sure why they call it a BDG on this site, since the label calls it a Golden.  They must have mixed it up with the Rioja.
On Tap in Overland Park-Barleys-  Decent amber ale, but would like a little more hops to balance out the malt.  Hard to say how fresh it was considering the number of taps they had avail.

This is my new favorite hoppy beer!!  My wife and I polished off a sixer over last weekend and I went back to buy what was the last sixer my store had.  I love the way the hops and rye intermix.  Damn nice beer.  Might have the best aroma Ive ever smelled hopwise.

Very nice beer.  A little dryer than Hoegarden-which is a plus in my book.  Having had two of their beers, my thought is just that theyre very very well made.  They almost taste like theyre handmade and you can kind of taste the difference.  Great stuff!!

I had this about a week ago and Im sitting here wondering if this is the best IPA Ive ever had.  Im not sure what would top it.  I prefer Alpha King, but its not truly an IPA and I definitely prefer this to Stone, so maybe it is my favorite.  Just wonderful stuff-hoppy, complex, well balanced.  Wish I could drink it more often.  Badass...

I cant believe I havent rated this beer yet.  One of my favorite stouts.  Id say its somewhere between a sweet stout and dry stout.  Lovely chocolate notes, enough body to hold up and light enough to have more than one pint.  My #2 fave McMens beer after Hammerhead.
Damn nice beer.  Definitely has the hop thing going on, but with a nice complex malt background as well.  Not something Id drink all the time, but a nice IIPA.
One of the best beers Ive had in a long time.  Elegant, distinctive, very drinkable and even a cute label to boot.  Cant wait to try more of the Jolly Pumpkins offerings.  Great stuff!

Nothing too crazy or exciting about this beer, but a nice summer beer that would be a great vehicle to a nice summer buzz.  Almost like a high class malt liquor, if I had to describe it to somebody. Id love more hop flavor and aroma, but other than that its great for me.
UPDATED: OCT 11, 2005
Simply the best Imperial Stout Ive ever had.  So smooth, balanced-only problem was that I drank almost a whole 750 by myself.  Oh well... had a good time.  Superb.

Only had a sample, so dont take my rating to heart.  More or less hits the mark in terms of hops, but didnt really thrill me.  Guess Im more of a west coaster when I look for an IPA.  Still a nice beer though.

Funny, the previous reviewer also got this as a beer of the month pick.  Ive only had Harpoons IPA before and was lukewarm to it.  Id say this is a pretty decent session beer, except it doesnt have enough going on to keep my interest for a session.  Malty-sweet-some interesting yeast character, but overall just kind of muddy.  Not bad, but not thrilling.

Came with my BOTM club shipment, so Ill try it.  Pretty nice overall.  Id like more hops, but then again, I always say that.  Definitely has the nice oatmeal and chocolate thing, so they named it right.  I doubt Id buy it in the store, but the three I got will be enjoyable.
beer_name: Sand Creek Oscars Chocolate Oatmeal Stout
